alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 05 at 5:56AM MDT until June 06 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of central Wyoming, including the following county, Fremont. * WHEN...Until 600 PM MDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas, with the best chance of flooding in Lyons Valley. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 539 AM MDT, on Monday, June 5, the Little Popo Agie River near Red Canyon was in action stage. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Lyons Valley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
